a: The symptoms of discoid eczema include circular or oval patches of eczema that can be pink, red, brown, or paler than the surrounding skin. The patches may be swollen, blistered, and ooze fluid. They are also very itchy, especially at night, and can become dry, crusty, cracked, and flaky over time.
